Class DungeonCharacter

java.lang.Object
DungeonCharacter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Hero, Monster
public class DungeonCharacter extends Object implements Serializable
Warrior class controller that extends Hero class @author: Toan Nguyen, Justin Noel

  • Constructor Details

    • DungeonCharacter

      public DungeonCharacter(String theName, double theHit, int theAttack, double theChance, int theMin, int theMax)
      THis is the super class for all hero characters
      Parameters:
      theHit - the characters health
      theAttack - the attack speed
      theName - the name for the character
      theMin - the min damage
      theMax - the max damage

      boolean isDead()
      Check to see if this character is still alive
      Returns:
      true if hit point > 0, false otherwise

    • applyDamage

      double applyDamage(double theDamage)
      Apply damage to this character, but also gave this character a chance to block or mitigate the damage Won't go over 0
      Parameters:
      theDamage - Damage this character should receive
      Returns:
      the damage it actually applied

    • normalAttackStrike

      double normalAttackStrike()
      Return a random number between the range [myDamageMin, myDamageMax) Will based on myHitChance if fails, return 0

    • normalAttackMove

      double[] normalAttackMove()
      Loop reflecting attack speed (how many times this character can strike in a turn) Call the singular attack methods to represent a strike
      Returns:
      an array, showing the damage for each strike
